content.text:
# List of World War I Czech flying aces

Austro-Hungary's  contained many aviators of Czech origin, i.e. ethnic Czechs and men born in the territory of the modern-day Czech Republic. The flying aces among them are listed below. At least one flier in the German Luftstreitkräfte was also of Czech origin.
{| class="wikitable sortable"
! Name !! Victories !! Notes
|-
| Julius Arigi
| 32 victories
| Austro-Hungarian Empire's second scoring ace served in World War II in the German Luftwaffe.
|-
| Paul Billik
| 31 victories
| Served in the German Luftstreitkräfte.
|-
| Eugen Bönsch
| 16 victories
| Served in the Luftwaffe during World War II.
|-
| Ernst Strohschneider
| 15 victories
|
|-
| Otto Jindra
| 9 victories
| Postwar commander of the Czech Air Force.
|-
| Heinrich Kostrba
| 8 victories
| First commanding officer of the Czechoslovak Flying Corps.
|-
| Josef Friedrich
| 7 victories
|
|-
| Otto Jäger
| 7 victories
|
|-
| Andreas Dombrowski
| 6 victories
|
|-
| Kurt Nachod
| 5 victories
|
|-
| Karl Nikitsch
| 6 victories
|
|-
| Karl Patzelt
| 5 victories
|
|-
| Karl Teichmann
| 5 victories
|
|-
|}

Grub Street. , .
